text:
This is review of Dec. 2014 vintage. 

Pours a black, opaque body, head is paper thin and milk chocolate colored. Lacing was not really there and neither was head retention. 

Smell is complex, mix of port wine, maple syrup, whisky, and sweet wort. Hops arent present, and alcohol, for being 11%, isnt overpowering. 

Taste is big on burnt malt, port wine, tobacco, charred oak, and finishes with some alcohol. Beer has a good amount of sweetness to balance all the other strong flavors.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, kinda on the lighter side for an imperial stout. Wish head was around for longer, carbonation was sufficient. 

Overall beer was good, cant say I enjoyed it much more than the non barrel aged version. Solid nonetheless, too bad Dark horse doesnt distribute to Colorado.

Chucks 85th, Seattle. Barrel Roller 2017. Darker tan ring foam, eggshell as SinH4 would say. Mostly black with some red light edges. Intriguing aroma of beer, in the pure and simple barley sense, and sticky fruity barrel flavors. Fruity banana bread, fruit cake, chalky cocoa impressions. Choco-banana candies from ex-Yu. Nicely bitter finish. Banana rather dominates, but in a fuller sense than esters alone. Bitter cocoa and simpler pure stout flavors. Really nice.

Bottle received via trade with antronnnn. Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, medium retention. Aroma is heavy roast and chocolate malt with light Bourbon and oak notes, leather, light earthy and woody hops and dark fruit, malt-derived. Flavor is heavy roast and chocolate malt, light earthy and woody hops and bitterness, leather, malt-derived dark fruits and a medium dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is sweet chocolate bourbon with hints of caramel. Taste is sweet rich chocolate, bready and bourbon with a chocolate bready malt finish. Excellent beer.

Bottle at home. Thanks Mike. Pours black, coffee colored head. Aroma is licorice, cocoa, vanilla, oak and Bourbon. Smells nice. Taste is dark chocolate, espresso, vanilla, boozy Bourbon. Smooth. Thick mouthfeel, velvety. A very nice beer.

Crowler (yes Crowler) from chucks hop shop cd. Not much head on pour from crowler. Raisins, dark coffee, brownies and licorice. There is some lingering acidity from the coffee. Hazelnut is one of the stars here. There is a bit of burnt sugar on the aftertaste. The barrel is not overly obvious here but it not missed. Quite amazing.

Bottled. Pours black not much of a head. Aroma is bourbon chocolate and vanilla hints. The palate is huge full body. Sticky. The taste is big bourbon. Malty sweetness and chocolate vanilla and some dark fruits. Great beer

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Bottled 2016 vintage. Pours pitch black, tan head. Aroma is smoke, bourbon, chocolate, roasted coffee, vanilla, tiny spot of raisin, leather, soy sauce. Flavor is super roasty, big boozy body, chocolate bourbon, vanilla, again, the tiniest drop of raisin, which I get but don?t think is there. boozy burn in the finish. Drinks big. Really good.

Sergeys hunt; 11% ABVBlack color. Nice aroma, roasted malts, cardboard, coffee, alcohol, hints of black liquorice, and even sourness. Medium body, too strong liquorice flavor, sour, and burning alcohol; no bourbon.Good beer, but weird, seems slightly infected.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 355ml bottle (thx, Yannick P.!) at my place with Alex and Ash. Vintage 2015. Pours like an oil, an almost black with a brown head. Aroma is dark fruits, roasted malt and seeds. Very roast and quite sour. Good.
Where is my lovely bourbon? :-(
2015 vintage. Tastes and smells terrible- very sour- highly likely infected. I have noted numerous other people have had the same experience over the past few weeks per Untappd.
Wybitny Stout. Genialny profil beczki, bardzo waniliowe, sporo czekolady, paloności, bardzo długi, rozgrzewający finisz. Suuuper.
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a small head. Aroma is chocolate and cocoa. Taste is cocoa and coffee, a little light, tasty and balanced but not incredible.

2015. Nothing wrong with this beer, but just like the base, a bit overrated. With soooooo many epic imperial stouts out there this is nowhere close to top 50. 
Big roasted notes as in the base. Bitter chocolate and molasses. Barrel is a normal bourbon presence - something I always like, but didnt stand out among other greats.

33cl Bottle courtesy of kermis, massive thanks! Black sticky goop with tan head. Big sweet deep roasted malts, big vanilla and bourbon, coffee, toffee, soft woodiness. Big sweet and mild chocolate bitter. Full body, soft carbonation, dense and thick texture. Big chocolate cake dipped in bourbon, very nice.

Bottle shared thanks to kermis. 2014 vintage. Black with big light brown head. Looks great! Lots of great bourbon, toffee, sweet chocolate, lots of dried red fruits, apricots, vanilla, light boozy, old red wine. Over medium sweet and almost medium bitter. Full bodied. Great BA stout the way I like them.

Vintage 2011. Got the bottle back in autumn 2012 from kappldav123. Big big thank you, mate! Pours out in the glass oily pitch black. No head. Fruity and dark choco on the nose. Taste starts strong, tough licorice, dark berriefuity background, also a lot of cacao. You may only take small sips. Increasing alcoholic, sensitive bitter, hints of malt, caramell and wildberry. Creamy and bitter sweet to the end. What a beer! [Test 12.10.2012]

(Dark Horse Bourbon Barrel Plead the 5th Imperial Stout) Bottle 355 ml at home, vintage 2014, served into a snifter, ABV 11%
Pitch black colour on the body, small but very thick dark brown head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma has lots of bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, liquorice.
Taste also of bourbon, vanilla, roasted malts, alcohol, liquorice, coffee, dark bitter chocolate
Thick full body with good amount of carbonation.
Very good and it gets better with every sip.

Another Dark Horse disappointment.
Totally unbalanced.
Bad carbonation, too much vanilla and bourbon.

Cheers to northern brews for the bottle. Thick black pour with a thin cocoa head. Toasted grain, vanilla, bourbon and chocolate aroma. Very complex and flavor meld well. Smooth chocolate and roasted grain with hints of bourbon and vanilla. Damn good brew.

August 29, 2015. Bottle at home, received in a trade with AtlCarl, thanks! Black with a small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, notes of sweet and salty licorice, coffee, dark chocolate, toasted coconuts, light bourbon character and hints of vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, smooth roasted bitterness. Finish is roasted bitterness with dark chocolate, roasted coffee, some sweet caramel, licorice, vanilla and a light warming bourbon touch. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Very nice, subtle barrel notes but the taste is well balanced.

Pours a jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, caramel, and roast. Flavor is roast, bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate. A little bit bitter, not too big of a body for an imperial stout. A high quality imperial stout, but not a stand out for me.

12oz bottle thanks to darrel. Pours out black topped with a small tan head. Nose is great big bourbon barrel notes vanilla coffee chocolate roast malts. Taste is amazing more of the big bourbon barrel goodness vanilla coffee roast malts chocolate. Wow this is nice.

12oz bottle with silver wax. A brief celebration that reasonable heads prevailed at tonights town meeting. Pours nearly black with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, oak. This is smooth with great depth of flavor. Dark chocolate, strong dark coffee, vanilla oak, bourbon. Theres a hint of overextracted coffee bitterness in the finish.

Little boozy , a lot of chocolate, Cherry oakiness, a lot of oAk at the nose, some bourbon notes. First Sip was brutal. Bourbon and chocolate meets forma very intriguing favor. With the warm there is a little sweet vanilla returns, but best part of this beer is alcool. Chocolate, dark chocolate, very very good one. oily feel, full body, smooth, extremely smooth.
Bottle shared. One of those big big whales, very rich mouthfeel, dark chocolate, dried fruit, vanilla, espresso, bourbon spice, fairly dry finish. Amazing stuff, decadent as some would say!

Bottle at home. This is one legit BA stout. Its full of chocolate and cocoa flavor, like youd expect, as well as some smooth, warming bourbon aromas, but it is extremely smooth and full-bodied, which really accentuates the other flavors. Rich, roasted, velvet smooth, and absolutely phenomenal -- one of the best beers out there.
Whisky, Oily, Coffee mocha, burnt flavours, vanilla and custard, cocoa nibs, flinty, dryish alcohol finish. Pretty smooth for such a big sipper.
Bottle - Dark cocoa and some roast. Deep jet black with a rich brown head. Sweet dark cocoa notes and nice light boozy heat. Its pretty nice.
Very whiskey roasted smells. Black non see through with tan head. Rich roasted wood fades to a big bourbon finish with out get to bitter in any direction.
Black. Muddled flavors. Some alcohol and lightly sweet. This is good but see!s a little messy. OK.heavily roasted. Dry finish.
Bottle shared at tasting. Dark black pour. Oakey wood and bourbon aroma. Taste is amazing, very smooth. Really good.

Smells like really old wood furniture. Heavy body, but not thick and chewy. Raisins. Dark black. No head. So smooth for a BA. Strong bourbon notes, but not boozy. Oak. I wish I had this next to a BCBS. Thx Malster85 for this want.

355 ml bottle at home, v2013, 11% ABV. Black color with beige brown head. malty aroma, sweet bourbon, vanilla, alcohol, wood, chocolate, dark dried fruits, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky body with soft carbonation.
Black pour, brown head. Beautiful. Amazing chocolate aroma. Flavor is full of espresso and dark chocolate. Really amazing.

sampler from Patrick thank you. poured a deep black low carbonation brown head. deep roasted malts, chocolate malts lots of goodness and even a little bitterness from the hops. the flavor is immaculate. the purest form of imperial stout imaginable. silky smooth with a hop kick. roast malts and chocolate slide off the tongue I still have 2 bottles from 2014. truly amazing stout.
Aromas of coffee and chocolate. Very dark. But if fruit and caramel but mostly coffee.

This is so good! 2014 vintage tasted in early 2016. Pours black with lots of cappuccino tanned head and chunky lacing. Nose is bourbon and molasses. Flavours of molasses, bourbon, vanilla, espresso, some mocha, maybe some fig. Taste big sweet, medium/big bitter. Full creamy body with medium carbonation. A beautiful beer.

33 cl bottle, 2014 vintage, sipped early 2016. Pitch black pour, with a small espresso head that gives way to a thin lacing. Smells of maple syrup, vanilla, bourbon, milk chocolate, cocoa, barrel sourness, caramel fudge and roasted malts. The taste is sweet, bitter and a bit sour, with notes of sweet bourbon, dark cherries, vanilla, cocoa and dark chocolate. The alcohol is quite present, but not too annoying. Medium to full bodied, with a sticky sweet aftertaste.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, 2014 vintage bottling. Pours dense pitch black color with a 1 finger dense dark brown head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of huge dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, toffee, biscuit, nuttiness, bourbon, vanilla, toasted oak, light smoke/char, light licorice/raisin, and roast/toasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt and bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of huge dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, toffee, biscuit, nuttiness, bourbon, vanilla, toasted oak, light smoke/char, light licorice/raisin, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light roasted bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, molasses, toffee, biscuit, nuttiness, bourbon, vanilla, toasted oak, light smoke/char, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and bourbon barrel flavors; with an awesome roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is incredible. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is a world class barrel aged imperial stout! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. The barrel integration and balance was absolutely spot on. There was no additional booziness or warming alcohol vs the base beer of similar age; and you still get plenty of the barrel flavor characteristics that arent overwhelming to the base stout at all. An insanely amazing offering.

Just as good as the original with a nice barrel element without being too hot. Well done.?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: heavily roasted malt, hint of alcohol. App: beautiful dark black with tan head. Taste: malt and chocolate notes, decent amount of oak and bourbon but not overpowering. Palate: full, medium finish. Overall: Really good. These are generally hit or miss for me depending on the amount of bourbon flavor. This is not overpowering but adds a good strong note.
Ruikt wederom barrel aged. Veel vanille idd , goede balans tussen zoet en chocola. Mooi dik ook
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, vanille, bourbon, alcohol. Smaakt vol, vanille, zoetig, koffie, almond. Lekker zoetig.
Zwart bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt vanille, geroosterd, chocolade. Vooral vanille. Smaakt vanille, koffie, geroosterd, chocolade. wow.

330 ml bottle shared with crew. Pours black with a short lived dark beige head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, salt, bourbon and wood. Flavor is chocolate, caramel, salty. Finish is wood, bourbon, caramel. Lingering roasted hazelnut. Medium to full body, oily and velvety mouthfeel, weak carbonation.
Inky brown black pour from bottle with reddish edges. Roasted malts and some vanilla. Chewy, dark chocolate. Mild burn. Pretty good.

pours unclear very dark brown with a reviving beige cap, nice lacing. dark roasted maltiness, bourbon-plenty, hazelnut spread, raspberry and vanilla, hint of smokiness, aniseed, resin. moderate to low carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet spicy-bourbons finish. good bourbon stout.

12 oz bottle (from notes). 

Aroma/Flavor: Rich, complex, and smooth. Well balanced Very lightly boozy; ABV seems notably lower than 11%. Fine whisky notes.

Mouthfeel: Very Full bodied.

2011 bottle. Sorry Eugene, meant to save this for you, but tonight was the night. Thick dark pour, minimal brown head. Aroma brings chocolate, caramel, cookie dough - minimal oxidation in nose. Roast is in background. Taste is moderately sweet, rich chocolate; oxidation in check. Full body, soft carbonation, silky smooth texture. Overall: this is pretty damned delicious.

4oz pour at Rustico Alexandria. Poured a dark, oil black color, velvet head. Aroma was rich dark chocolate with roasted malts. Lots of roast. Dark brown sugar notes, sweetness. Some earthy hops are in there. Flavor was pretty tasty - light woody notes, chocolate, with molasses, light coffee notes. Liked it.

I know all you other "awesome sauce" beer buys will be able to pick out the chocolate, or cherries, or coffee. ....... I cant. 
I just like beer. I like Imperial ale and Imperial Stout. And this for me is damn good beer! Only other one that I have had (to date) that is better is Againt the grain 70k. If you trip across this one please buy it.

Pitch black and opaque with a one finger beige head that slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Very good retention for style and ABV, taking a while to settle and lingering throughout the pour. Sporadic streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Nice barrel presence in the nose thats decently integrated into the base. Stronger oak/wood/toothpick than expected wih sweet, spicy bourbon silky vanilla and marshmallow. Not overly boozy however with complex barrel character not just a complete bourbon bomb. Sweet an roasted malts underneath with some robust coffee bean, oatmeal, dark chocolate and liquid smoke. Some dessert like sweetness with silkier, lighter chocolate, lactic cream, caramel, toffee and bakers chocolate. Pretty tame aroma but its complex and well rounded. 

Fuller end of medium body with a strong, boozy barrel character thats nicely integrated into the flavors of the base beer. Again, theres a strong charred oak/toothpick character along with prominent spicy bourbon and boozy heat dominating the flavor. Lots of spicy bourbon along with vanilla bean and mallow. A touch of cinnamon and spicy heat but not too hot or overbearing. Although there is plenty of alcohol flavor, the high ABV is relatively well masked. Underneath the strong barrel flavors, there is some robust, roasted dark malt notes with burnt sugar, coffee grinds and bitter dark chocolate complimenting the oak and spirit. Could use a bit more sweetness but this beer is nicely balanced and surprisingly easy to drink at 14%. The complexity of the barrel component adds depth of flavor making this beer very enjoyable.

12 oz. bottle poured into a Kuhnhenn snifter. 2012 vintage. Originally reviewed 1/2/2013. Very think inky black pour with a small mocha head. Nothing left after a while. Just a thin collar and three measly and miniscule islands of foam. The barrel is very nice, but the aroma of the beer is intense. Bourbon, tons of oak, and a nice hint of vanilla from the barrel. Sweet malts, licorice. Coffee and dark chocolate are afterthoughts compared to the barrel, booze, and sugars.

In the taste, the base beer shines through the barrel, but it adds a nice layer. Bourbon is immediately apparent. Deep dark chocolate flavors and a sweet fruit layer. Oak is really intense in the back. Lingering oaky finish is too strong and just pegs it back from perfect. Its heavy, boozy, and overly oaked. Low carbonation. A monster of a beer.
 While this beer is spectacular, the barrel hasnt improved it. Intense oak creates an unpleasant aftertaste. That being said, I had this on tap and it was incredible. Batch to batch may vary. I certainly wont mind exploring different vintages of this.

Black body with a brown head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. Taste is similar and sweet, with bourbon, vanilla, roasted, chocolate, maybe some caramel. Full body with low to medium carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Pours black with a small light brown head. Head retention is poor. AROMA: rich dark roasted malts, dark bitter chocolate, coffee, caramel, oak char, roasted nuts, herbs, herbal hops, alcohol, butterscotch, toffee, slight earthy funk, raisin, slight citrus, soy sauce, dark stone fruit, vanilla, banana, smoke, floral, peppercorn, spices, molasses, burned brown sugar, pine bitterness, dry chili, dates and bourbon notes. TASTE: rich dark roasted malts, dark bitter chocolate, bitter coffee oil, caramel, oak char, roasted nuts, herbs, hops spice, alcohol, butterscotch, toffee, slight earthy funk, creamy, raisin, soy sauce, dark stone fruit, vanilla, smoke, floral, peppercorn, spices, molasses, burned brown sugar, banana, pine bitterness, dry chili, dates, slight citrusand bourbon notes. AFTER TASTE: bourbon, caramel, vanilla, peppercorn, molasses and dark rich malt with a creamy buttery finish.

Bouteille 355ml, 2014, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka foncée riche et crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de boisé, Bourbon, alcool, malt torréfié, noix, chocolat. Goût de malt torréfié, Bourbon, chocolat noir, café en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps dense, collante.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2015 12oz bottle. Opaque dark brown hue, moderate, light brown foam. Bourbon, chocolate, oak, ripe banana, caramel, turbinado sugar, coconut and vanilla notes - nicely complex, yet drinkable. Full body and moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Long time want. Thanks hackobock! Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of licorice, coconut, chocolate, coffee, light vanilla and light wood. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and wood. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Pretty nice, but the bourbon character isnt super pronounced.
Very thick and rich tasting. Lots of vanilla and bourbon whiskey. A hint of fresh tobacco too. Thanks to Martinus for the sample!

Black, tan head. Aroma of Bourbon, vanilla, caramel, wood, banana, chocolate. Sweet flavour, vanilla, Bourbon, chocolate, caramel and soy sauce. Quite boozy. Finish malts, caramel, wood, Bourbon, vanilla and soy sauce.(from 35.5cL bottle shared @ De VIP School Gent, GBF 2015. Bronze Wax. From trade. Thanks for muling the beers for me, Eugene. Cheers!)

Thanks to Martinus! Sampled 355 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2015. Waxed! Pours pick black with very dark small mocha head. Nose is very thick warming bourbon, boozy, rich thick black chocolate, big in spirit quality. Taste is big quite boozy, big spirit, sludge, bourbon, big thick black chocolate, light molasses, raw, touch sugar, more black chocolate. Very thick oily body. Very strong, quite nice, I preferred the non-BA version, it isnt like I tasted them side by side. Very nice still, a bit too strong & booze, light soy sauce. Strong.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2016 Courtesy of 77ships at Gents Bierfestival. Thanks very much for this one! The bourbon barrel aged version of an already great American RIS, so I was very curious about this. Deep beige, stable head over a practically black beer; complex and beguiling aroma of indeed rich bourbon and beautiful woody tannins, spanning a whole array of basic RIS qualities, including chocolate, coffee grounds, banana peel, bayleaf, deep caramel, candied dates; very rich and complex taste, basically the regular Plead the 5th with all its depth, velvety mouthfeel and deep caramelly and chocolatey maltiness along with a prolonged roasted bitterness in the end, but deepened further with drying but delicious woody notes (tannins) as well as bourbon warmth, a bit alcoholic but only adding complexity and elevating this wonderful stout to a higher gastronomic level. Formidable, I can see how this scores so high on this site.
Dark Horse knows their stouts. Another home run. Will travel to find this BA stout.
Bottle - pours black with tan head. Nose is bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate. Taste is fudgy chocolate, vanilla and bourbon.

Black with a light brown head. Aroma is bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, dates, raisins, molasses. Full bodied, slightly velvety mouthfeel, rich on the palate, well balanced, well hidden booze. Taste is chocolate, dares, molasses, cocoa bitterness, cinnamon.

22/VI/15 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: n/a, 2014 vintage (2015-810)  Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy dark brown to black beer, big creamy beige to brown head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: malty, roasted, coffee, earthy, bit sourish. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: bit sweet, caramel, lots of chocolate, bit sugary. Aftertaste: mocha, vanilla, caramel, dried fruits, little bitter, milk chocolate, slightly sour, very balanced and nice, lovely beer!

dense beige head. coffee coloured. aroma is vanilla, bourbon, roasted malts. taste like aroma, chocolate, boozy with a long finish. dense silky mouthfeel, rather soft carbonation. praline in a glass! bottle / 2013 edition

Bottled. Pours opague black with a small, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark fruits, vanilla and bourbon. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, slightly bitter with some alcohol. Full bodied, oile texture and soft to flat carbonation. An excellent Impy. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Botle @ ZEBF 2015. Aroma of coffee and vanilla, with subtle roast. Taste is quite nice, with thick bourbon booze vanilla, coffee, chocolate and smooth roasted malt. Great beer.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Pours a dark dark brown with a small beige rim that leaves few lacing. Nose is of coconut, vanilla, rich caramel and chocolate. Taste is of chocolate, grapes, alcohol, vanilla and chocolate. Super oaky/barrel flavor, a bit too much for my taste. Body is full and carbonation soft. Alcohol is a bit hot. Good but not great, a bit rough.
Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Black, brown foam. Soft carbonation. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, vanilla, some fruitiness, and bourbon. Well balanced. Not too sweet. Good!
Drank at ZeeBra 2015 (21-6-2015), thanks Wouter for sharing. Very rich taste, excellent. Chocolate, vanille, caramel fuss. Reminds me of the Hunnapuh. Really liked it.
Expected more from this one for sure. Still very nice, but misses a boost, specially if you know how many alcohol is inside this one.

12oz silver waxed 2011 bottle thanks to alexsdad from his 2015 FBW contest. Poured a thick black color with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of boozy bourbon, licorice, dark malts, oak, and caramel. Taste of syrupy molasses, roasted malt, strong bourbon, vanilla, barrel, slight oxidation, and a sweet toffee finish.

Bottle @ home. Opaque pitch black color, average to medium sized a bit fizzy, quickly diminishing very dark brown head. Aroma is malts, dark malts, bourbon, vanilla, wood, oak, lightly sweetish and lightly alcohol. Taste malts, roasted malts, dark malts, bourbon strongly, vanilla quite firm, initially a light sweetness linked with the vanilla, changing in the middle to a roasted malt bitterness with a light alcohol burn, finishing with wood, more bourbon, slightly vanilla, roasted malts and bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation. I would have loved it to be even more oily and thick texture-wise, but this is one hell of a beer. Magnificent!

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Bottle shared by Bursprak. Thanks buddy, youre the man :) Pours pitch black with a big dark brown head. Aroma is pretty fruity, vanilla, dark chocolate, savory licorice. Taste is vanilla, light amount of roast, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, dark fruits, fudge, some licorice.
Dark and oily pour. Low tan head. Roast and caramel in equilibrium. Hints of chocolate and coffee, with bourbon barrel character in hints of coconut and vanilla. High and ticky body.

Bottle, extra from a trade over on BA. Split two ways. Pitch black pour with a small tan head. Nose has vanilla, some dark dried fruits, fresh coffee, caramel and some salty licorice. Taste is smooth, vanilla, light roast, milk chocolate and some light fruity notes.

Wee bottle as an extra in a trade with knickskicks - you rock! - cons 2015-05-12 Spring Hill - 11% and golden wax
AR: caramel, bourbon vanilla, milk chocolate when poured scottish fudge
AP: black on black, wee frothy diminishing dark brown head
F: rich carbonation, heavy warming feeling, dark milk chocolate bar, scottish caramel fudge, bourbon vanilla, full bodied long and lasting flavors, great brew! And yeah - some american chocolate cookie cream ice cream
By far the best thing that Dark horse puts out. Great stout to get your hands on if you can.
Yes, yes, yes please. This brew is aged perfectly in bourbon barrels and oh so enjoyable. Taste and enjoy.

Ba plead the 5th 12 vintage, huge thanks to Ron for the bottle!

Has a viscous black color, with a dark brown, fizzy head, revealing a small film of lacing at the edge of the glass.

Smells of cocoa nibs, toffee and lots of warm oak, exhibiting distinct vanilla notes. A hint of cinnamon settles among toasted malts and tobacco, while the aromas lead into a rich chocolate direction. Well pronounced barrel reveals quite a bit of Bourbon, which gets gently balanced by melted chocolate. 

Drinks expectedly smooth, letting the complex character evolve.

Tastes of bakers chocolate and fudge, accompanied by whipped cream, while scorched malts, hot oak, cinnamon and mint reveal the beers fantastic flavors. The brews smooth mouthfeel sets new standards, which gets especially well accentuated by carbonized malts, earth and bitter coffee, providing a tremendous range of flavors. Has a hot, oak supported finish, with toffee, fudge and vanilla on top, while coffee creates a long lasting, slightly dry ending, with tobacco and earth.

Awesome beer, incredibly rich in flavors - very focused on creamy chocolate, and roasted coffee with burned malts as its counterpart, while staying focused and in perfect balance. This intriguing melange gets enriched by the hot boubon barrel, adding vanilla and wooden oak to the taste, as well as a hot glow. Chocolate developes on the palate, beginning as creamy milk chocolate, while ending as slick bitter chocolate.
Bottle poured into a snifter..dark as night with a thin tan head..aroma of bourbon,caramel,dark fruits,vanilla,wood..tastes of coffee,dark fruits,bourbon,smoke..excellent.
Wow wow wow wee wow! Bottle shared by a generous person at DLD. Impressive... most impressive.
Been meaning to try this for a while and it happened at dark Lord. Expectation is met. Words words words words words words

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home, 2014 bottle thanks to Jdizzle1. Pours pitch black with a tiny light brown head. Aroma is coffee, roasted malt, bourbon, caramel, vanilla, oakm chocolate and cherries. Flavour is light sweet, medium coffee bitterness. On the salty side. Full bodied, crazy oily, soft carbonation. Finish is acidic coffee, smooth and long.

Bottle received in a trade with tferillo, cheers! Pours pitch black with a notable brown head which soon recedes to a bubbly ring around the glass. Aroma is jampacked with vanilla, malt sweetness, roast malts, dark chocolate, milk chocolate, slight cinnamon spice and mild coffee. Taste is vanilla, oak, leather, molasses, burnt sugar, slight creme brulee, raisins, dried fruits. Theres a hint of ginger spiciness and almond velvetiness. Full bodied with sticky and oily mouthfeel.

Bottle, Boise imperial stout tasting. My first taste of the night, this was a solid opener. Near black pour and small brown head. Nose is bourbon, espresso, and chocolate malt. Heavy roast and espresso, lighter in vanilla and some bourbon. It hints at woody, but overall very smooth.

12 oz bottle from xdtfx. Nose is vanilla, chocolate, oak, roast, and a hint of molasses. Black with a medium cinnamon tan head. Flavor is lightly sweet and peppery with a hint of char along with the aromas present in the nose.

2012 bottle grey wax thanks to Tom. Pours black with beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is roast, wood, vanilla, bourbon. Slick mouthfeel, dark chocolate, wood, vanilla, roast, lingering bitterness, very impressive.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Sweet bourbon, vanilla, light roasted malts, chocolate, and a quick easy finish. Balanced, not at all over the top. Delicious.

2013 Vintage. Pours very dark with a thick brown head. Aroma is complex, roasted coffee, chocolate, deep roasted with some faint oak bourbon character. Another great gift and proof that I am blessed. Vintage 2014 (2 months old). 2011 vintage on draught at Deep Ellum, 2/22/14Wow, glad I just happened to stop in to Deep Ellum in the 14 hour window this stuff was on tap, haha.Pretty cool that they just threw this aged keg on with no fanfare or announcement and even cooler that I was there to try it.Pours an inky black, seemingly opaque, with a fleeting beige head that recedes quickly and completely.Molasses, light milk chocolate and dry, leafy, mildly citric hops up front while the bourbon character rounds out the finish with very light butter-rum and coconut notes. Nice and reserved, just the way it should be. Aroma strength is medium, much due to the very low carbonation, and probably in part to the barrel tannin as well. No flaws and very little of the alcohol noted (this cant possibly be 14%, by the way).Soft, silky and rich in the mouth, it certainly has all the characteristics of Dark Horse. Comforting, almost chewy texture, well-extracted, rich malts, no obnoxious/overdone flavors. Milk chocolate and light roast are most prominent, while some vanilla-like dryness and a bit of rum soaked raisin notes help balance. Very very low carbonation and again, no sign of the alcohol. Yes, its Plead the 5th, which in my mind, is a well-done but fairly simplistic Imperial Stout, with an added layer of bourbon. So in this case, the barrel-aging actually helps add depth, but ultimately, Im not wowed by the rather lacking vinous/roast/prune notes that I really love in a great imperial. Still, nothing to scoff at and Id happily drink this over many (most?) other imperial stouts. Though it loses some points in complexity, it makes up alot of that in balance and mouthfeel.

Bourbon Plead the Fifth comes out of the bottle without any hurry, filling up my glass with an obsidian black liquid. Adjusting to an aggressive pour, I am able to encourage a small dark mocha head to form for a few minutes. It slowly gives way to a thin ring of dark froth around the edges and leaves just a couple spots of lace on the glass.

The aroma at this stage has such a nice balance between the the chocolate and roasted notes from the stout and the character from the barrel. It almost feels like rich fudge is entering my nose as first, with roasted notes, a bit of coffee, lots of vanilla, and finally a smooth bourbon note.

The flavor starts off with rich dark chocolate fudge, with vanilla and bourbon twisting their way in. As my palate adjusts to the flavor overload, roasted malt and a bit of bitter coffee notes work their way in. A small amount of general dark fruit flavor comes in later on in the sip. It starts out very sweet, and ends up being a bit more rounded by the end of the sip. The flavors work so well together.

Each sip is a reeducation about how the mouthfeel of a bourbon barrel stout should feel. Thick and rich, the barrel did nothing to reduce the impressiveness of this mouthfeel. The carbonation is nearly crushed by the thickness of the beer but retains a silky smooth quality.

Overall this is definitely a very well made bourbon barrel stout. It is definitely worth seeking out and having around. At this point I have not had it at different ages, but it is delicious with almost a year on it.

T: Very, very sweet. Bourbon appropriates the top level here and adds a sweet sting on top of a very pronounced sweet malt body. M: Super boozy, but its got a wonderfully filling mouthfeel. Other RISs should pay attention to this aspect, its the best Ive had outside Apple Brandy Hunahpus.

tap at 2013 michigan winter beer fest. black and thick stout. intense big flavors of bourbon, chocolate malt and mild booziness. nothing subtle about this, but its quite good.

Taste has some great roasting elements with some subtle bourbon and alcohol notes underneath. Gets even better as it warms. Wow.

Pours a thick black from the bottle with thin film of a head and nice film on the glass too. Aroma of sweet chocolate and vanilla, a deep bourbon richness, and slight roasted malts. Taste follows, with hints of dark fruits and licorice. Very complex and wonderfully balanced. Damn good, thanks to the RBWG for the taste.

Huge thanks to Tom for sharing this. Inviting aroma of dark chocolate, licorice and a nice oak presence. Im also getting dark fruits such as plums and dates. The fruitiness also stands out in the taste almost givingin a quad feeling. Palate is low carbed as you can expect from such a big stout but mouthfeel is sily and oily. It feels to me like a successfully new take on this very popular style.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2013 Bottle (12 oz) vintage 2011. Traded by Whatsarezaf, thanks Reza! Black with small dark brown head. Aroma is of vanilla, anise, caramel/toffee, chocolate, roasted malt and slight fruity notes. Taste is moderately sweet with tons of vanilla, fruits, caramel/toffee, anise/liquorice, chocolate. Slight roasted finish. Warming alcohol. Full bodied. Complex and well-balanced. Very good RIS.

2012 bottle, poured into a snifter. Pours jet black with a deep tan ring of foam. Aroma is HUGE. Smells of espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, bourbon, dark fruit. Taste is sweet and has medium bitterness. Mouthfeel is so rich and creamy. Smooooth. Fantastic beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black pour with thin brown lacing. Redolent aroma of caramel, chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malt, balanced with plum, blackcurrant, figs, and charred wood. Full-bodied, sweet, creamy, and smooth. Some bitterness in the long finish; alcohol is well masked.

2011 Bottle, thank youso much kappldav123. Black, no head. Dark chocolate, vanilla and cigar aroma. Sweet bourbon barrel star: Vanilla, milk and dark chocolate, fine tobacco notes. Finished off with aromatic and herbal hops which keep a bit in the background, but fend of the sweetness well. Fullbodied mellow mouthfeel. Sweet, wellrounded finish, well-balanced, sweet, but never gets cloying - a nice desert.

Tap takeover at chrunchy's in east lansing. Finally got a chance to try this and was beyond impressed. I was expecting the bourbon presence to be hot and it was anything but. Silky smooth texture with vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and wood flavors.  This is now my favorite beer.

Another from my trade with deyholla. Pours viscous black with one finger brown mocha head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet molasses, dark fruits, roast, and something off that I am not a fan of (similar characteristics to Tres). Thick viscous mouthfeel with medium low carbonation. Heavy dark fruit up front followed by lots of dark bittersweet chocolate. Slight booze, but don't get much of the bourbon barrel in this. Was expecting a bit more canilla oak, though my palate might be tainted from the Kuhnhenn BA 4D I had right before this. I tend to prefer non-fruity stouts, but this is generally well done. Relaxing sipper.

2012 bottle from trade with rayl101.  Pours dark black in color with a small dark brown head that fades quickly.  Aromas is delicious.  Subtle bourbon, sweet rich chocolate, caramel, light roast, soy sauce, and light tobacco.  Taste is amazingly balanced for a BB imperial stout.  All of the aromas come through at different times.  Silky smooth finish, slightly boozy.  Fairly thick mouthfeel.  Great imperial stout.  Really excited to see what could happen with a couple years in the cellar on this.  Thanks Kevin!

Pours a dark brown with a very nice coffee brown head with little lacing. Smells delicious! Hints of bourbon, malt and lots of chocolate. The taste is a fantastic balance of bourbon, chocolate, malts and a subtle hint of coffee. The palate is great as the flavors change as it warms. One of the best stouts Ive had in a long time!

12 ounce bottle. 2012.  Thanks Mike!  Pours a deep black with a small reddish brown head.  Aroma of malt, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, and wood.  Taste is bourbon, roast, dark chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla, and oak.  Excellent!!
2012 bottle. Pours a dark brown with a small tan head of foam. Raisin and Bourbon come through, with the Bourbon in the forefront. Drying raisins are on the finish. Awesome beer.

4th October 2011Opaque black beer, rich chocolate coloured head. Smooth palate, semi dry. Interesting beer! Strawberry and violets tang leading to rich dark malt. Trace of woody vanilla. Mild minerals. A little yeasty dark chocolate. Whsipers of Port and Brandy in the finish which is semi dry. Very nice!

2012 Vintage
Aroma has nice chocolate notes with complimentary bourbon and vanilla character. There are secondary notes of coffee and oak. As the beer warms you pick up a bit of dark fruit but its fairly low. No hop aroma and only faint alcohol notes. 
Pours a deep black with a dark mocha head that clings to the edges but never really forms in the center. No lacing and mid sized legs. 
Flavor has more roast and alcohol than in the aroma but still well balanced. Starts with more sweet, dark chocolate and vanilla. Mid palate the roast steps in with some oak. The finish has bourbon, vanilla, a hint of dark fruit and bittersweet chocolate. There is some alcohol spice in the finish. Medium low bitterness and no astringency. 
Mouthfeel is full bodied with low carbonation. Medium high alcohol warmth and low astringency. 
Overall this is a really nice beer. I am usually let down by some of the hyped beers I trade for but this one at least partially lived up to the hype. As it warns the alcohol does become a bit hot though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2016 12oz bottle, 2012 vintage, shared by b3shine. Dark black, pretty opaque color. Good dark brown head. Little lace. Good chocolate, vanilla nose. Big body. Light carbonation. Chewy texture. Light vanilla, big roast, nice wood, bitter taste, light sweet, some alcoholic bite. Nice vanilla, wood, roast in the finish. Awesome 8/4/8/4/17 Update rate, 1/21/16: 12oz bottle, shared by Chris R. 2015 vintage. ABV is marked on the bottle as 11%. Nearly pitch black color. Ring of bubbly light brown head, some bits of lace. Awesome dark chocolate, heavy roast malt, some nice coffee, great bit of bourbon oak flavors, giving some charred wood and vanilla, that blends perfectly with the stout. This is some special stuff. Bigger body. Nice chewiness. Lighter, kind of crisp carbonation. Mild slick. Moderate to bigger bitter taste. Moderate to bigger sweet. Nice bit of alcohol warmth. Loving the big dark chocolate and coffee notes in the finish. A fantastic barrel-aged stout, very enjoyable.

Very think inky black pour with a small mocha head. Nothing left after a while. Just a thin collar and three measly and miniscule islands of foam. The barrel is very nice, but the aroma of the beer is intense. Bourbon, tons of oak, and a nice hint of vanilla from the barrel. Sweet malts, licorice. Coffee and dark chocolate are afterthoughts compared to the barrel, booze, and sugars. Bourbon is immediately apparent. Deep dark chocolate flavors and a sweet fruit layer. Oak is really intense in the back. Lingering oaky finish is too strong and just pegs it back from perfect. Its heavy, boozy, and overly oaked. Low carbonation. While this beer is good, the barrel hasnt improved it. Intense oak creates an unpleasant aftertaste.

12oz bottle, 2012 vintage, graciously shared by Jeff.  Thanks! Pours a jet black color with a tan head that fades to some bubbles around the edge.  Aroma is chocolate, some bourbon, a little toasty.  Medium to heavy on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, roasty, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, a little nutty, with a light bourbon finish.  The level of bourbon is just right here.

Pours a deep rich black color with a two finger mocha foam that sticks and floats with great lasting power. On the nose there is a big dose of vanilla, fudge, marshmallow and some deep bourbon touches. On the palate its velvety smooth and amazingly rich. Big chewy fudge and roasty chocolate on the front end with a rich complex finish that flows with smooth sweet flavors that match the nose nicely..... a pleasure to drink till the last drop !

Bottle shared by Greg - thanks!! Dark black pour with a small tan head. Bourbon in the nose, vanilla and toffee. Really nice blend of the imperial stout and bourbon. Just enough heat that works well with all the flavors. Nice!

12oz bottle, shared by Greg/John, one of them. This is a standout beer as well.. great taste with mild sweetness coming through overtop of the roast, the vanilla only briefly shows itself and the mouth feel is a big full stout letting you know this isnt for sissys.

Silver wax 12oz 2011 vintage via trade. Poured a solid black body with an average sized foamy dark mocha colored head. Aroma is probably the best quality of this beer, notes from the bourbon add a distinct vanilla and toasted coconut along with some wet cvharred wood, the beer itself has dark wet burnt toast, bad dark chocolate, dark fruit skins and a slight earthiness along with a touch of yeast. The body is silky and drinkable although it coats your mouth and has little to no carboantion. I couldnt imagine drinking more then one of these. Flavor is far drier then the aroma with dry drak chocolate, vanilla extract, tobacco, soy, bourbon, barrel, dark toast, wax paper. Solid beer but I was expecting a little more.

This bottled brew from the brew pub during rbsg #38 poured a small sized head of frothy medium sized dark brown colored bubbles that were mostly diminishing and left behind a no visible carbonation opaque and a poor lacing. The mild aroma was dark malt. The mouth feel was tingly motor oil thick at the start with a mellow roasted malt finish. The thick flavor contained notes of roasted malt very mild bourbon and dark malt. Delicious and one I would certainly like to have again.

2011 bottle from JALE. Sweet silver wax job that really helps keep the cap in place? Oil slick pour with light cabonation and a small head. An almost meaty aroma with bourbon in the background. Nice flavor with some sweet vanilla, some bitter cold espresso and some warming booze. Tasty. My 2500th rating.

Black pour with a dark brown, dense head. Lots of coffee and nutty aromas. Sweet licorice as well. The barrel just presents itself a little on the nose. Lots of chocolate.. A little spice and plenty of depth. The mouthfeel is on the lighter side surprisingly but its still full bodied, if that makes any sense. The flavours are complex and plentyfull but this one lacks a little carbonation.. Lots of chocolate and oak spice and even a little clove and rumcake coming through. The finish is long - dry and oily at the same time.

Pour pitch black, with a huge slightly creamy dark brown head. 
Aroma has plenty of coffee. Chocolate, bourbon, wood, slight vanilla, roasted malts, oatmeal, booze, slight licorice. 
The taste is rather sweet upfront, with a rather heavy dose of roasted and bitter end to it. 
Somewhat full bodied, with a flat carbonation. Thanks to Ryan for sending me this bad boy.

2012 vintage. 12 oz silver waxed bottle into a brandy snifter. Cant thank Steimie enough, this was a huge want of mine!

A - Pours a thick black body with a finger of dark mocha head. After that fizzles away its quite difficult to recreate a head with a swirl. Just some splotchy lacing with some nice retention. Alcohol legs stain the sides of the glass.

S - Bourbon dipped fudge brownie is the description I would use here. Rich and gooey dark chocolate, dry cocoa powder, light espresso and coconut. Finishes with smooth oak and vanilla and warming alcohol which does comes off as a bit too distracting.

T - Starts with dark chocolate and light roasted malts. Then comes a huge wave of vanilla, oak, and butterscotch. Lighter notes of coffee beans, coconut, and dark fruits. The finish is fudge with a bit of leather. Rich and decadent, just fucking perfect!

M - Thick and coating, just a notch below syrupy. Carbonation is spot on.

O - Truly one of the best BA stouts out there. How anyone can trade this stuff after sampling it is beyond me. Compared to its major 12 oz competition, well I think I like BCBS a bit more since its a brash stout that is all about the bourbon. This beer is much more balanced with the bourbon complimenting the base beers notes. God dammit this is good stuff!
12oz bottle. Rating #202. This was pretty damn tasty. Lots of stuff going, nice barrel character, bourbon, vanilla. Great stuff. (2595)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Nicely done bourbon barrel imperial stout. Nutty, anisey and sweet. Comes together really well as a slow sipper.

Pours dark brown with a small light brown head. Aromas of caramel, coffee and bourbon soaked chocolate. A very nice combination of a big rich stout with a hint of bourbon. Very well balanced. A great beer.

Pours jet black with a dark brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, oak and bourbon. Taste follows, slightly sweet and boozy, alcohol burn on the finish, lots of vanilla in this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle, sent from northernbrews (thanks a lot, Jeff), pours jet black with a small light brown head. Nose is adequately bourbon-heavy, without drowning out the base beer, with melted chocolate, some light liqueur notes, and bourbon - very decadent. Flavour is complex as hell, with the bourbon barrels so perfectly accentuated the already complex and decadent base beer, without making this boozy or barrel-dominating. There are notes of chocolate, liqueur and vanilla underneath, all luxuriated by the barrels. Very soft-feel to the body - very velvety and silky. The finish is both bourbon and chocolate, without any alcohol burn at all - even less so than the base beer. Heavenly stuff.

Bottle @ FOneFan. Almost black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, oak, little liquorice and a little dark fruits.

Bottle @ "Det er meget mørkt i Ulfborg", November 2012. Pours black with a creamy bubbly beige head. Nose is bourbon, oak, vanilla, roast and liquorice. Smooth and full bodied. Sticky and oily. Sweet.  Warmth from alcohol. Really tasty!

On draft at GABF 2012.  Pours a dark obsidian with a tan head.  Nose is roasted malts, chocolate, coconut, mallows, and bits of booze with wood.  Flavor is similar- big chocolate, fudgy with wood, vanilla, mallow, hints of coffee, and a nice sweetness.  Medium in body and lingering oaky booziness in the finish.

Aroma- incredibly huge bourbon, massive dark fruits which consist mostly of plums and blueberries, some roasted notes, more barrel qualities
Appearance- outer space black with a nice tan head, massive alcohol presence
Taste- melded tastes of bourbon, oak, plums, figs, milk chocolate, more barrel hits, roasted barley, alcohol heat and more bourbon at the end, silky fucking smooth
Palate- full, creamy, out of this world
Overall- Maybe my favorite beer, Im not sure yet but its probably the one.  Sensational everything in this beer.  Will need to get again for sure.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 2011 bottle from Mane Liquor. Hot damn this is like oil! A very small, dark and sinister looking head is produced but lasts for the duration. Some spotty lacing as well. Nose is very bourbon forward with some heavy dark cacao and coconut. Almost salty chocolate on the nose. Taste is very heavy on dark chocolate and bourbon. Its sweet, bitter, fudgey, burnt and decadent. Lots of sweet and sinister tones meld together in a very balanced fashion. Theres a slight boozy kick on the finish with some heat but its rather pleasing. World class stuff
Bottle (shared with the Mrs.) to snifter (thanks mikem409). Looks good; pitch black with tan lacing. Smells sweet, malty, and boozy. Tastes the same with a good mouthfeel. Nice!

Botella @ KingCecils birthday party. Pitch black colour, steady nice light brown head. Sweet lovely roasty malty dark fruity bourbon aroma. Good filling mouthfeel. sweet roasted maltiness in the flavour with dark fruits, chocolate, bourbon, some vanilla and alcohol. Very nice!

355 ml bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours oily viscous pitch black with a thin dark chocolate brown head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, dark roast coffee, dry peppery wood, vanilla fudge, bourbon, black pepper, lemon zest, coconut and burnt caramel. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and very tiny metallic with heavily roasted malts, bitter chocolate, bourbon, dark roast coffee, vanilla fudge, burnt caramel, alcohol and hints of black pepper and wood. Mouthfeel is round, soft, smooth, slightly boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with heavily roasted malts, vanilla fudge, bourbon, bitter chocolate, dark roast coffee, burnt cookies, caramel and hints of minerals, rich and great! Very prominent but elegant barrel aging.

(Bottle) Pours black with dark brown head. The aroma holds medium dark chocolate, caramel, smooth bourbon (coconut and vanilla), tobacco, dark fudge, blueberry jam and hints of toasted nuts. The flavor is light to medium sweet, near medium bitter and tiny acidic with notes of creamy chocolate, perfect, roast, coconut fudge, vanilla ice cream, blueberry jam and resinous hops. The mouthfeel is round,  soft, smooth and light firey with a light carbonation. Balanced yet aggressive finish. Medium to full bodied.
Sampled at UCTS testing. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Smells and tastes coffee, roasted malt, abit barrie creamy chocolate, abit spicy.

Sampled at USSkovde
Black with no head. 
Some light, milky chocolate in the aroma. 
Milky chocolate in the flavour. Heavily roasted. Sweet fruits; prune.

Bottle at USA comes to Skövde. Pitch black beer with a small brown head. Malty vinous aroma, chocolate, cocoa powder, vanilla, bourbon, coffee beans, licorice, milky, raisins, spicy notes, figs, berries, tar notes. Woody whiskey flavor, peat, milk chocolate, vanilla, raisins, hay, caramel, soot, tar, cocoa powder, coffee, dades, some plums.

Bottle @ rlgks tasting. Pours black with a small diminishng tanned head. Aroma is sweet roasted malty vanilla dill pleasntly fruity. Flavor is velvety slightly acidy alcohol caramel roasted vanilla bitter fruity pears; nice. Finishes bitter roasted vanilla and warming boozy aftertaste.

12 oz waxed bottle served in a FW tulip. We did a side by side with the base beer.

A: Pours a jet black with a quick dissolving dark mocha head forming on the pour. A very thin ring is left over that leaves no lace, but there are some nice legs.

S: Really smooth and sweet bourbon up front. Chocolate, roasted malts and oak. Dark chocolate and raisins on the finish.

T: Bourbon up front like the nose, but again, its very smooth and sweet. Just a touch of heat comes from it. Sweet caramel and oak barrel. Coffee like dark chocolate with a little bitterness to it. The finish is toffee and raisin.

M: Thick and heavy bodied. Creamy mouthfeel with a medium to low carbonation level. 

O: The barrel aging really took this beer to another level with out sacrificing the complexities of the base beer. Im glad it still retained the body that regular Plead the 5th carries. A must try.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-21-2012
Very nice. Really strong boozy presence. Sharp roasted malt character. Bitter chocolate and some dark fruit.

Sampled at GABF 2012 with Moreau, Andrew and Sofia. Pours a pitch black body with thin chocolate brown lacing. Aroma is straight bourbon, sweet chocolate, and some deep espresso in the back. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy with the bourbon really taking control, but still balancing nicely with the chocolate. Awesome.

Bottle @ my birthday ´12 vintage 2011.... It pours pitch black with a small bubbling tan head.... the aroma is bourbon, sweet dark fruits, oak and caramel.... the flavor is so nice bourbon, dark fruits, chocolate with alcohol notes.... nice warming alcohol finish....

Bottle at Kingcecils Birthday Tasting. Pours opague black with a creamy light brown head. The aroma is vanilla, oak, hard roasted malt, sweet ripe fruit, chocolate and light coffee. The flavour is sweet malty and has loads of bourbon oaky and vanilla notes. Sweet ripe fruit, chocolate and light coffee. Great things going on. Incredible indeed!

Bottle from trade with Rayl101. Black pour, very low head that disappears quickly. Aroma is mild, of dried fruit, chocolate, bourbon and very slight alcohol bite; nice complexity, but not sweet, heavy, or over done at all. Carbonation is soft, mouthfeel is complex. Finishes has long lingering flavor with just a bit of bitterness. This is really nice; a top notch BA Impy. A favorite.

Bottle pours pitch black and coats the glass like oil.  Tan head.  Heavy mouthfeel.  Aroma is wood, bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate.  Flavor follows the nose and has a nice chocolate note upfront, some booze, rich caramel in the middle, and finishes with a great chocolate bourbon note.  This beer is simply fantastic.

A-- Poured black, settled black. Just hints of ruby in the pour and at the top of the beer. At best a dark reddish brown film. Good collar though. Very little if any head. A few carbonation bubbles but not a lot to this. A dark oily residue left with this and just a bit of spotty lacing. No ABV legs for this ABV of a beer. 

S-- Wow, big aggressive nose. Big, dark chocolate. Not powder but chocolate. Roasted fig or date, roasted prune, almond or walnut (the wood from the barrel) smell underneath the fruit and chocolate. Rich and thick nose full of bourbon and barrel. Heck yeah. 

T-- Thick liquid chocolate, followed by prune, walnut, carmel, and some small amounts of roasted almond. Bourbon is really present in this. Just a thick and rich taste. Flipping scary beer.

M-- Heavy feel but lighter in the mouth than one would suspect. Carbonation?? Try again on that. Little to no carbonation. Silky smooth feel though. Alcohol is very obvious on this going down. Very oily, rich feel in the mouth. Dark, bitter chocolate is also made known in the mouth. Literally gets richer and gets more depth as work through this. Bourbon that hides as a port. Long lasting flavor that kicks ass. Wicked stuff. 

O-- Slow sipper is a good starting point. Big, bold balsy beer. Not for the faint one bit. Beats the heck out of most BA RIS. Worth finding. Worth savoring

Bottle. Have had many finally rating. Pours black medium body reddish head big head for barrel aged stout. Big bourbon cherry aroma. Taste nuts vanilla and burnt sugar. Little bourbon on finish love this LOCAL beer:)

Sampled at EBF. One of the few stouts I was  really interested in sampling. Super dark color, very oily and thick. Aroma really jumps out at you with hints of bourbon, chocolate, vanilla and woody characters. Flavor is heavy and thick on the chocolate malt side. Definitely a sipper
12 ounce thanks to Sparky in Summer 12 Secret Santa. Carbonation slowly rises after pour to tan head. Big bourbon nose and body. Some bourbon burn in first sip. Oily and heavy. Nice.

Draft at the brewery!  This is an incredible beer.  The pour is opaque and the aroma is huge malt, roast and hops.  Flavors are caramel, vanilla, roasted malts, bourbon and oak.  Intense and complex, a beer layered with flavors that rivals any Imperial Stout out there on the market.

2011 vintage 12oz. bottle. It pours a very dark brown with a brown head. The aroma is very inviting with rich chocolate, vanilla, coffee and sweet dessert. The flavor is the same with lots of vanilla, chocolate, tobacco and coffee. The body is obviously big and full, but its not too syrupy and the beer remains pretty drinkable. No fusel alcohols. This is what all bourbon barrel imperial stouts should strive to be.

Bottle:
Small brown head, changes slowly into a brown lacing on top of a pitch black beer. Less head but looks good.
Smell bourbon, hint of soya, liquorice, vanilla, black roasted/burned barley malts, light creamy and a slight slight hint of something pee ish.
Lovely smooth bourbon smell with some roasty barleys. Spice and vanilla notes and some dark roasty herbal chocolate notes.
Taste bourbon wood, vanilla, nicely roasted barleys, spices, nice bitter, oak/wood, vanilla, roasted smooth wood, roasted barley malts, chocolate, 
Aftertaste is a subtle mix of bourbon/vanilla, wood, something lit yeasty, bitter, a slight hint of dark fruits, light grassy and some chocolate drenched hop.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, full body and a creamy smooth light sticky texture.
Very well balanced, lovely bourbon notes and some extravagant spicy notes.
